Description: To settle a Clean Air Act case at a natural gas facility, owner Merit Energy and former owner Shell Exploration agreed to pay a penalty of $500,000; Merit also agreed to spend $1 million on an environmental project.
Agency: Justice Department Environment and Natural Resources Division
Notes: Note: This penalty is a duplicate of an amount shown in another record (either because it applies to a multi-location settlement or because Violation Tracker contains an agency record and a settlement announcement for the same case).

Agency: Bureau of Safety and Environmental Enforcement

Description: Curing the course of an inspection the following items were discovered: Containment decks had multiple areas of corrosion; Gas detectors were not in service; the quarters building was within 10' of production; there were missing records of subsurface safety devices being tested; compressor PSVs were set greater than the maximum allowable pressure; and there were multiple violations of unsafe and unworkmanlike conditions.
Agency: Bureau of Safety and Environmental Enforcement
Bureau of Safety and Environmental Enforcement

Description: During the course of an inspection, it was discovered that the purge mechanical ventilation system for the Mud Logging Unit (MLU) building, placed in a Class 1 Division 1 Hazardous Area, was found switched to manual bypass. It was also discovered that the fresh air intake for the MLU building was located within the Class 1 Division 1 hazardous area.
Agency: Bureau of Safety and Environmental Enforcement

Description: During a BOEMRE inspection, it was discovered that a tubing plug was set above the mud line. There were also several severely corroded critical areas on the equipment and platform
Agency: Bureau of Safety and Environmental Enforcement

Description: During an annual inspection on September 3, 2009 the pressure safety high/low for the FA-2 flow line segment for Well B-2 was discovered to be in by-pass at the control panel and was not monitored and/or flagged.
Agency: Bureau of Safety and Environmental Enforcement

Description: During the course of a BSEE investigation into a crane incident, the inspectors discovered that operator failed to follow safe lifting policies and procedures and to accurately identify the weight of the load prior to lifting operations.  July 31, 2011
Agency: Bureau of Safety and Environmental Enforcement

Description: During the course of a BOEM inspection, the inspection revealed a failure to correct corroded deck drain and produced water lines.
Agency: Bureau of Safety and Environmental Enforcement

Description: During the course of a BOEMRE inspection, the inspectors discovered the pressure safety valve (PSV) on the first stage compressor discharge with the manual block valve on the inlet of the PSV was in the closed position, rendering the PSV inoperable.
Agency: Bureau of Safety and Environmental Enforcement

Description: During the course of a BOEMRE investigation into a flash fire injury occurrence, it was discovered that unsafe and unworkmanlike operations were present while attempting to establish fluid returns from Well A-1. This resulted in 1st degree burns to the pump operator. It was also discovered that the coil tubing head was leaking oil and gas and was within 10' of the facility gas compressor, which was operating during the coil tubing operations.
Agency: Bureau of Safety and Environmental Enforcement

Notes: Penalty includes a supplemental environmental project with an estimated cost of $30,000 (and a minimum cost of $12,500)

Description: violations of oil pollution prevention regulations
Agency: Environmental Protection Agency referral to the Justice Department
